title: 'Our house has lost £75k in value due to a huge quarry being reopened nearby. Do we have any rights?'
text:
Every week, the Telegraph’s Property Doctors bring expertise on renovations and DIY, interiors, buying and selling, lettings, legal issues and taxes – addressing three topics. Send your questions to propertydoctors@telegraph.co.uk

Buying and selling

Q I live near where a multi-billion-pound company has been given permission by the council to extend its workings at a quarry to the land west of my home. Previously it was meant to only be open for two more years and then returned to nature, but this development means that its life has now been extended until 2060.

We have been trying to sell our home since June 2017, but have only received one offer for far below the asking price. We have had...
description: Every week, the Telegraph’s Property Doctors bring expertise on renovations and DIY, interiors, buying and selling, lettings, legal issues and taxes – addressing three topics.
